issues.title: Missing Conflict of Interest Requirements
issues.description: California law requires that advisory committee members file conflict of interest statements (Form 700) when they may make or participate in decisions that could affect their economic interests. The policy and regulation lack any reference to conflict of interest requirements, disclosure obligations, or procedures for handling potential conflicts.

legal_citations.text: No public official at any level of state or local government shall make, participate in making or in any way attempt to use his official position to influence a governmental decision in which he knows or has reason to know he has a financial interest.

issues.required_language: Advisory committee members shall comply with conflict of interest requirements under the Political Reform Act. Members may be required to file statements of economic interests (Form 700) if they participate in decisions that may affect their financial interests. Members must disqualify themselves from participating in decisions where they have a financial conflict of interest.

issues.title: Missing Committee Appointment and Selection Procedures
issues.description: While the regulation mentions "procedure to be used in the selection of the committee chairperson," neither document establishes procedures for appointing committee members themselves, including application processes, selection criteria, term limits, or removal procedures. This is essential for transparent and fair committee operations.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district may initiate and carry on any program, activity, or may otherwise act in any manner which is not in conflict with or inconsistent with, or preempted by, any law and which is not in conflict with the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures for committee member appointment including: application processes, selection criteria, term lengths, procedures for filling vacancies, and grounds and procedures for removal of members. Selection procedures shall ensure fair representation and comply with applicable anti-discrimination laws.

issues.title: Incomplete Reference to Required Advisory Committees
issues.description: The regulation lists specific committees subject to Brown Act requirements but may not include all legally mandated advisory committees. For example, it doesn't specifically reference Parent Advisory Committees required under LCAP (Education Code 52063) or other specialized advisory committees that may be required by state or federal law.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district shall establish a parent advisory committee and, if applicable, an English learner parent advisory committee, to review and comment on the local control and accountability plan.

issues.required_language: Add to the list of committees: "Parent Advisory Committees and English Learner Parent Advisory Committees established pursuant to Education Code 52063 related to Local Control and Accountability Plans"

issues.title: Missing Records Retention Requirements
issues.description: The documents do not address retention requirements for committee records, meeting minutes, and other documentation. This is important for compliance with public records laws and district record-keeping requirements.

legal_citations.text: Public records are subject to disclosure under the California Public Records Act and must be retained according to established schedules.

issues.required_language: Committee records, including meeting minutes, agendas, and supporting materials, shall be retained in accordance with the district's records retention schedule and made available for public inspection as required by the California Public Records Act.
